subproject.corporate outcome: National and local institutions have the capacities to reduce the impact of disasters, especially climate change related disasters, on vulnerable communities
subproject.description:
-	32,623 anti tanks and anti personal mines removed (out of the estimated 136 000 mines for the Northern Border CP)
-	223,360 square meters cleared and 
-	2,107,200 square meters verified by mine detection dogs and and machines                  
-	short term Job opportunities for local population, in particular women
subproject.title: Northern Border Mine Clearance

subproject.corporate outcome: National and local institutions have the capacities to reduce the impact of disasters, especially climate change related disasters, on vulnerable communities
subproject.description:
The Mine and Unexploded Ordnance (UXO) problem in Jordan derives from the 1948 partition of Palestine, the 1967–1969 Arab-Israeli conflict, and the confrontation with Syria in 1975. The minefields are limited to three major areas, the Northern Highlands, Jordan Valley and Wadi Araba in the south. Basic maps were kept for all minefields. There are also UXO in a small number of areas centred in the Ajloun and Irbid governorates. 

According to original military estimates, some 305,000 anti-personnel (AP) and anti- tank (AT) mines were laid on Jordanian territory (73,000 Israeli and 232,000 Jordanian mines). Jordan’s mine action plan of June 2005 states that 35 million square meters of land across 314 minefields remained contaminated with 203,094 mines, of which 156,371 were AP mines.
subproject.title: North border mine clear-CANADA

subproject.corporate outcome: National and local institutions have the capacities to reduce the impact of disasters, especially climate change related disasters, on vulnerable communities
subproject.description:
The mine and unexploded ordnance (UXO) problem in Jordan derives from the 1948 partition of Palestine, the 1967–1969 Arab-Israeli conflict, and the confrontation with Syria in 1975. The minefields are limited to three major areas, the Northern Highlands, Jordan Valley and Wadi Araba in the south. Basic maps were kept for all minefields. There are also UXO in a small number of areas centered in the Ajloun and Irbid governorates. 

According to military estimates, some 305,000 antipersonnel and anti-vehicle mines were laid on Jordanian territory (73,000 Israeli and 232,000 Jordanian mines). Jordan’s mine action plan of June 2005 states that 35 million square meters of land across 314 minefields remained contaminated with 203,094 mines, of which 156,371 were antipersonnel mines.

According to military estimates, some 305,000 antipersonnel and anti-vehicle mines were laid on Jordanian territory (73,000 Israeli and 232,000 Jordanian mines). subproject.title: Northern Border-AusAid-NPA

subproject.corporate outcome: National and local institutions have the capacities to reduce the impact of disasters, especially climate change related disasters, on vulnerable communities
subproject.description:
-Assist Jordan in meeting their obligations under article 5 of the Mine Ban Convention by contributing to the clearance of a 104 km mine belt containing an estimated 136,000 landmines in an area of approximately 10 million m2 of land along the Jordan-Syria border.  The project will be called the Northern Border Clearance Project (NBCP).

-Reduce the level of risk for the approximately 50,000 people living close to the border and contribute to increased local socio-economic development.
subproject.title: Northern Border Clearance-AusA
